definition: to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
harsh and unreasonable/unexpected

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: There is no law and order and motorcycle gangs terrorize the country.
sentences.chinese: 世間沒有法律和秩序，只有飛車黨橫行霸道。

sentences.english: The more the reactionaries lash out, the more resistance they provoke.
sentences.chinese: 越是橫行霸道，就越發激起更強烈的反抗。

sentences.english: The street was overrun by the bullies last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年那些暴徒在街上橫行霸道，無惡不作。

sentences.english: The Fascists once tyrannized a large part of the world.
sentences.chinese: 法西斯曾在世界很大範圍內橫行霸道。

sentences.english: During the Second World War, China had been overrun by Japanese invaders.
sentences.chinese: 二戰期間，日本侵略者在中國橫行霸道，無惡不作。

sentences.english: For many hundreds of years, the armies of the Dark Gods had ruled triumphant over the realms.
sentences.chinese: 數百年來，黑暗之神的軍隊一直在諸域橫行霸道。

definition: to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
feudalism
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
traitor
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
to fool/to hoodwink/to dupe
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
harmful teachings/evil doctrine
to disrupt/to throw into disorder
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
